title: MAG 167 - Curiosity Transcript-converted
text:
The Magnus Archives – MAG 167 – Curiosity 
1 
MAG 167 — Curiosity 
Content Warnings 
• Manipulation 
• Reported violence 
• Immolation / Death by fire 
 
[The Magnus Archives Theme – Intro] 
JONATHAN SIMS 
Rusty Quill presents... The Magnus Archives. Episode one hundred and sixty-
seven: "Curiosity." 
[Theme finishes] 
[Tape clicks on] 
[A wasteland wind swirls; footsteps on gritty ground] 
[Hissing static starts] 
ARCHIVIST 
Help us with what? 
MARTIN 
Excuse me? 
 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 167 – Curiosity 
2 
ARCHIVIST 
Annabelle, help us with… what, our, our, our journey, killing Elias, vanishing the 
Entities— what? 
[They stop walking] 
MARTIN 
Please don't do that. 
ARCHIVIST 
Do what? 
Oh, oh, right, ye-, I see, yes. Well, I— Sorry. 
MARTIN 
It doesn't… feel great, having someone looking inside your head. 
[They start walking] 
[Hissing static ends] 
ARCHIVIST 
You can… feel it? 
MARTIN 
No, but that's hardly the point, John— 
ARCHIVIST 
Oh, no, I see, sorry, um, right. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 167 – Curiosity 
3 
MARTIN 
I mean, I don't want to keep secrets from you, but— 
ARCHIVIST 
You should at least, be able to. 
MARTIN 
Basically, yeah! 
ARCHIVIST 
I-I suppose that's fair. 
MARTIN 
It's just— it's weird knowing that you can know literally everything I think and 
feel. E-especially since you're not exactly the most open of people, 
emotionally, I mean. 
ARCHIVIST 
What that's not fair; I share! 
MARTIN 
Sure you do. 
ARCHIVIST 
I do. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 167 – Curiosity 
4 
MARTIN 
Okay, so how exactly would you describe your current emotional state 
regarding all of this? 
ARCHIVIST 
Gah— 
MARTIN 
Go on, I'm all ears. 
ARCHIVIST 
I feel… 
MARTIN 
Mm-hmm? 
[Backpack zippers jangle as they stop walking again] 
ARCHIVIST 
(Sigh) I feel… sad. 
MARTIN 
(Flat) Sad. 
ARCHIVIST 
Very sad. 
MARTIN 
(Flat) Very sad. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 167 – Curiosity 
5 
ARCHIVIST 
Yes, alright; point taken. 
[They start walking] 
MARTIN 
You said you could control it now. 
ARCHIVIST 
I can, I, I just— I— 
You're absolutely right. I will refrain from knowing anything about you. 
MARTIN 
Thank you. 
ARCHIVIST 
Unless you're in danger. 
MARTIN 
(Laughingly) Physical danger; If I'm in danger of being mad at you or 
something— 
ARCHIVIST 
(Crosstalk) I— 
MARTIN 
—you've got to figure it out the old-fashioned way. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 167 – Curiosity 
6 
ARCHIVIST 
Fine. Agreed. 
(Sighs) 
So. What did Annabelle say? 
MARTIN 
She offered to help, but she didn't say what with; she asked us where we were 
going; I didn't tell her, but... it was pretty obvious she had a good idea? 
ARCHIVIST 
Did you, feel like she was influencing your mind at all? 
MARTIN 
I don't think so, but I mean... who knows? 
ARCHIVIST 
I could. 
MARTIN 
(Getting forceful) But look. She didn't control me into asking you not to look 
into my head, if that's what you're thinking. That's all me— 
ARCHIVIST 
Martin, I'm not looking for a loophole. 
MARTIN 
Well, good, 'cause this isn't one. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 167 – Curiosity 
7 
ARCHIVIST 
(Teasing) Methinks the Spider doth protest too much. 
[Martin stops walking] 
MARTIN 
(Annoyed) John— 
ARCHIVIST 
Joking! Just joking. 
[They start walking] 
MARTIN 
Do you know where she was calling from? 
ARCHIVIST 
No. She, no. She's still… hidden, somewhere; I, I can see her voice coming 
down the phone line, but the closer it gets to her the harder it is to see. 
Mm, Christ, this all feels so… obtuse; it's like, I have the power to drink the 
whole ocean, but I have to do it through a straw. 
What? 
MARTIN 
Just, I don't know, it-it worries me, I guess? You know, when you do the whole- 
(imitating the Archivist) ‘curse this flesh prison’ thing, it, I get you're different; 
none of us are what we were, but, well? It worries me. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 167 – Curiosity 
8 
ARCHIVIST 
Sorry. 
MARTIN 
That's not… It's okay. 
(The Archivist sighs) 
MARTIN (CONT’D) 
Anyway, my flesh prison (small laugh) would like to stop for a bit. How far until 
the next... domain? 
ARCHIVIST 
A while. If you want to stop, it's as good a place as any. 
MARTIN 
No, I just, need a moment. (sigh) One where I'm not just relentlessly pushing 
forward. 
ARCHIVIST 
(Large sigh) Alright, we can stop. 
[They stop walking and sit down] 
(Long beat) 
MARTIN 
Why did it have to be us?
